intro: Talinella microphylla, commonly known as the small-leaf talinella, is a flowering plant native to the western Pacific region. It is a member of the Myrtaceae family, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its small, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of white or pale pink flowers. It typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy soils and salt spray. Talinella microphylla is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
